translation: O Vaiṣṇava Goswāmī, please be merciful to me this one time. You are the saviour of the fallen; without you there is no one.

text: kāhāra nikaṭe gele pāpa dūre yāya
emana dayāla prabhu kevā kothā pāya
translation: Just by being in your presence, sins go far away. Where can anyone find such kindness?

text: darśane pavitra kara ei tomāra guṇa
translation: Merely by the touch of the waters of the sacred Ganges one becomes liberated, even if he is the lowest of mankind; but just by seeing you, the same effect is achieved. Such is your quality.
If one commits an offence at the feet of Lord Hari, he can be forgiven if he chants the Holy Name. But if one offends you, there is no salvation for him.
In your heart Govinda is always resting. Śrī Govinda Himself says, “My devotees are My life and soul.”

text: prati janme kari āśā charaṇera dhuli
translation: I hope that in every birth I will obtain the dust of your lotus feet. Śrī Narottam prays, “Please, Oh Vaiṣṇava Goswāmī, be kind unto me.”
